ray.surface

Class Mesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.surface.Surface
      • ray.surface.Mesh

  • public class Mesh
extends Surface
    Basic packed triangle mesh. The triangle mesh is primarily data storage, all geometric interaction is handled through MeshTriangle objects.
    Author:
    arbree Aug 19, 2005 TriangleMesh.java Copyright 2005 Program of Computer Graphics, Cornell University

    • Field Summary

      The number of vertices in the mesh *
      protected float[] texcoords
      The texture coordinate array -- may be null *

      Mesh triangle objects for each triangle.
      protected float[] verts
      The vertex array -- always present in each mesh *

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mesh

        public Mesh()
        Default constructor creates an empty mesh

      • Mesh

        public Mesh(float[] verts,
            int[] tris,
            float[] normals,
            float[] texcoords,
            Material material)
        Basic constructor. Sets mesh data array into the mesh structure. IMPORTANT: The data array are not copies so changes to the input data array will affect the mesh structure. The number of vertices and the number of triangles are inferred from the lengths of the verts and tris array. If either is not a multiple of three, an error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        verts - the vertex data
        tris - the triangle data
        normals - the normal data
        texcoords - the texture coordinate data
        material - the material for the mesh

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(IntersectionRecord outRecord,
                         Ray ray)
        Description copied from class: Surface
        Tests this surface for intersection with ray. If an intersection is found record is filled out with the information about the intersection and the method returns true. It returns false otherwise and the information in outRecord is not modified.
        Specified by:
        intersect in class Surface
        Parameters:
        outRecord - the output IntersectionRecord
        ray - the ray to intersect
        Returns:
        true if the surface intersects the ray
        See Also:
        Surface.intersect(ray.misc.IntersectionRecord, ray.misc.Ray)

        public boolean chooseSamplePoint(Point3 iRec,
                                 Point2 seed,
                                 LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)
        Description copied from class: Surface
        Choose a random point to sample illumination from this surface as an emitter.
        Specified by:
        chooseSamplePoint in class Surface
        Parameters:
        iRec - a point where the emitted ray pointing to
        seed - seed used to generate a random point on the surface
        lRec - the output information about the illumination
        Returns:
        true if success
